data_encrypted: I would like to repeat my appreciation to all the speakers and especially to the rapporteur, Mr Christian Caro.
Yes, Mr Helder Chatelain, I feel an initiative of the type you have just suggested would be entirely appropriate.
Mr President, I am happy to take the floor in the debate on this report and I congratulate Mrs Bayram Barber.
I would therefore ask you, Mr Abderrahim Carroll, to make an explicit reference to this problem in your reply today.
Meanwhile, Mr Blaise Austin Hulten has been inundated with amendments, more than 100 amendments in the first round.
Mr President, firstly I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations to my colleague, Mr Blaise Austin Hulten.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to begin by thanking Mrs Colin Arturas, the rapporteur, for her work.
Mrs Colin Arturas' s report marks a further step towards the transparency and effectiveness of structural aid.
One or two years ago, Parliament adopted a report by Mrs Darrin Bill which is extremely important in this context.
I would merely say that the festive issue which Mr Gul Begum has raised is an extremely important one.
Not even Mr Sichrovsky' s web of lies or Mrs Darryl Chas' s words of appeasement can do anything to change that.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to thank Mr Cameron Aaron for his excellent work in this important matter.
Yes, Mrs Colin Arturas, I shall be pleased to look into the facts of this case when I have received your letter.
As you know, like Mr Dec Carlier, I come from a transit country, where this issue plays a particularly important role.
Mrs Abdelhamid Banks Gorsel, I can tell you that this matter is on the agenda for the Quaestors' meeting on Wednesday.
I would like Mr Darnell Deep Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Mr President, Graeme Daren, I want to begin by thanking Mr Rapkay for a good report and constructive cooperation.
Mr Alassane Boulet' s report also emphasises the importance of the international dimension with regard to competition law.
Mrs Darryl Chas' s report has, however, turned out very well, at least where the prescribed guidelines are concerned.
Mr President, Commissioner, in this minute and a half I should like, first of all, to congratulate Mrs Colin Arturas.
I shall therefore, with your permission, give the floor to Mrs Aubrey Baptiste to reply to you under the procedural motion.
Madam President, I clearly owe Mr Alastair Bertrand an explanation, and I am going give this explanation before the whole House.
Mr President, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Elyes Amaan, so many names we remember with horror.
I have clearly received your series of messages on this subject and I believe that Mrs Aubrey Baptiste has an answer for you.
Mr President, I would like to start by extending my compliments to the rapporteur, Mr Blaise Austin Hulten, on his first report.
Devin Barrientos President, Mr Jonckheer has stated that this could be one of the measures for stabilising the financial markets.
In other words, we should ensure that the money falls to Mr Dec Cairns' s sphere of competence and not to other spheres.
In her report, Mrs Faouzi Bonnin also drew attention to an area where coordination is sorely lacking, yet desperately needed.
Mr President, I also wish to congratulate Mr Blaise Austin Hulten on this first piece of work which he is presenting to the House.
Mr Fethi Ashok, I would like to say that I have the greatest sympathy for the concern underlying the issue you have raised.
And so, Mr Aldo Bryant, I shall also mention at this point, speaking of the national level, the link with the Cohesion Fund.
Mr President, it is incumbent upon me to remind my colleague, Mr Helder Chatelain, of why Wales actually achieved Objective 1 status.
In this regard, I liked your term, Mrs Alexander Bar Vallelersundi: we must all pull together, preferably in the same direction.
Mr President, I would like, in beginning my speech regarding the White Paper, to congratulate the rapporteur, Mr Bilel Barragan Wogau.
Mrs Bayram Barber probably forgot to include a European prison now that we have the FBI, the European police, in the form of OLAF.
The manufacturers have tricked Mr Florenz and Mr Belkacem Baz into tabling amendments here which seriously weaken these proposals.
I would like to point out to Mrs Anthony Arslan that what we have read recently in the press is true, and that figures do not lie.
My colleagues, Mrs Frassoni and Mr Harpreet Cobb have already spoken, somewhat sceptically, about some aspects of the matter in hand.
Madam President, I do not wish to reopen the debate, but I had also asked for the floor, to comment on Mr Darnell Deep Crespo's motion.
This is extraordinarily positive, and there is cause to thank the rapporteur, Mr Christian Caro, for the work he has put in on this issue.
Mr Demetrius Amor, I would like to thank you just as warmly for your report on the seventh survey on State aid in the European Union.
At the request of a French Member, Mr François Cousins, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself.
I therefore give the floor immediately to Mr Arron Al, in his capacity as draftsman of the opinion of the Committee on Budgets.
I commend Mr Florenz, Mr Belkacem Baz and others who have sought from both sides of the party divide a compromise based on shared costs.
Mrs Aubrey Baptiste apparently promised to write a letter explaining why permission was withdrawn but so far no letter has been received.
We will be happy to incorporate Mr Byron Dav' s notes into the bibliography, as another bedside book for the Members to bear in mind.
Madam President, first of all I should like to thank Mr Christian Caro for his report which has, at its heart, the issue of transport safety.
Consequently, I have tabled some amendments to Mr Christian Caro' s intrinsically excellent report, which have been adopted by our committee.
We will continue to do that with energy and with consistency and as Mr Demetrius Bk said in the debate, 'necessarily with acute vigilance' .
I should also like to make a few comments, firstly, Mr Hocine Armando, regarding the assessment you have made of this sixth periodic report.
data_encrypted_translated: J'aimerais renouveler mes remerciements à tous les orateurs et en particulier au rapporteur, M. Christian Caro
Oui, Monsieur Helder Chatelain, je pense qu'une initiative du type que vous venez de suggérer serait tout à fait opportune
Monsieur le Président, je suis heureux de prendre la parole dans le débat sur ce rapport et je félicite Mme Bayram Barber
Je vous demande donc, Monsieur Abderrahim Carroll, de bien vouloir faire explicitement référence à ce problème dans votre réponse aujourd'hui
Entre-temps, M. Blaise Austin Hulten a été inondé d'amendements, plus de 100 amendements au premier tour
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais tout d'abord adresser mes plus sincères félicitations à mon collègue, M. Blaise Austin Hulten
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier Mme Colin Arturas, rapporteure, pour son travail
Le rapport de Mme Colin Arturas marque un pas de plus vers la transparence et l'efficacité de l'aide structurelle
Il y a un an ou deux, le Parlement a adopté un rapport de Mme Darrin Bill qui est extrêmement important dans ce contexte
Je dirai simplement que la question festive que M. Gul Begum a soulevée est extrêmement importante
Pas même le tissu de mensonges de M. Sichrovsky ou les paroles d'apaisement de Mme Darryl Chas ne peuvent rien y changer
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, je voudrais remercier M. Cameron Aaron pour son excellent travail sur cette question importante
Oui, Madame Colin Arturas, je me ferai un plaisir d'examiner les faits de cette affaire lorsque j'aurai reçu votre lettre
Comme vous le savez, comme M. Dec Carlier, je viens d'un pays de transit, où cette question joue un rôle particulièrement important
Madame Abdelhamid Banks Gorsel, je peux vous dire que cette question est à l'ordre du jour de la réunion des questeurs mercredi
Je souhaite que M. Darnell Deep Crespo, qui en a fait la demande, prenne la parole pour la proposer, s'il le souhaite bien entendu
Monsieur le Président, Graeme Daren, je tiens tout d'abord à remercier M. Rapkay pour son bon rapport et sa coopération constructive
Le rapport de M. Alassane Boulet souligne également l'importance de la dimension internationale en matière de droit de la concurrence
Le rapport de Mme Darryl Chas s'est toutefois avéré très bon, du moins en ce qui concerne les lignes directrices prescrites
Monsieur le Président, Monsieur le Commissaire, en une minute et demie, je voudrais tout d'abord féliciter Mme Colin Arturas
Je vais donc, avec votre permission, donner la parole à Mme Aubrey Baptiste pour vous répondre dans le cadre de la motion de procédure
Madame la Présidente, je dois clairement des explications à M. Alastair Bertrand, et je vais les donner devant toute l'Assemblée
Monsieur le Président, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Elyes Amaan, autant de noms que nous nous souvenons avec horreur
J'ai bien reçu votre série de messages à ce sujet et je crois que Mme Aubrey Baptiste a une réponse pour vous
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais tout d'abord féliciter le rapporteur, M. Blaise Austin Hulten, pour son premier rapport
Devin Barrientos Président, M. Jonckheer a déclaré que cela pourrait être l'une des mesures pour stabiliser les marchés financiers
En d'autres termes, nous devrions nous assurer que l'argent tombe dans le domaine de compétence de M. Dec Cairns et non dans d'autres domaines
Dans son rapport, Mme Faouzi Bonnin a également attiré l'attention sur un domaine où la coordination fait cruellement défaut, alors qu'elle est absolument nécessaire
Monsieur le Président, je tiens également à féliciter M. Blaise Austin Hulten pour ce premier travail qu'il présente à l'Assemblée
Monsieur Fethi Ashok, je voudrais vous dire que je suis très sensible à la préoccupation qui sous-tend la question que vous avez soulevée
Et donc, Monsieur Aldo Bryant, je mentionnerai également à ce stade, en parlant du niveau national, le lien avec le Fonds de cohésion
Monsieur le Président, il me revient de rappeler à mon collègue, M. Helder Chatelain, pourquoi le Pays de Galles a obtenu le statut d'objectif 1
À cet égard, j'ai aimé votre expression, Madame Alexander Bar Vallelersundi : nous devons tous tirer à la même corde, de préférence dans la même direction
Monsieur le Président, je voudrais, en commençant mon discours concernant le Livre blanc, féliciter le rapporteur, M. Bilel Barragan Wogau
Mme Bayram Barber a probablement oublié d'inclure une prison européenne maintenant que nous avons le FBI, la police européenne, sous la forme d'OLAF
Les fabricants ont incité M. Florenz et M. Belkacem Baz à déposer ici des amendements qui affaiblissent sérieusement ces propositions
Je voudrais faire remarquer à Mme Anthony Arslan que ce que nous avons lu récemment dans la presse est vrai, et que les chiffres ne mentent pas
Mes collègues, Mme Frassoni et M. Harpreet Cobb, se sont déjà exprimés, avec un certain scepticisme, sur certains aspects de la question qui nous occupe
Madame la Présidente, je ne souhaite pas rouvrir le débat, mais j'avais également demandé la parole pour commenter la motion de M. Darnell Deep Crespo
C'est extraordinairement positif, et il y a lieu de remercier le rapporteur, M. Christian Caro, pour le travail qu'il a accompli sur cette question
Monsieur Demetrius Amor, je voudrais vous remercier tout aussi chaleureusement pour votre rapport sur la septième enquête sur les aides d'État dans l'Union européenne
À la demande d'un député français, M. François Cousins, une pétition a déjà été présentée, que de nombreuses personnes ont signée, dont moi-même
Je donne donc immédiatement la parole à M. Arron Al, en sa qualité de rapporteur pour avis de la commission des budgets
Je félicite M. Florenz, M. Belkacem Baz et les autres qui ont cherché, des deux côtés de l'échiquier politique, un compromis fondé sur le partage des coûts
Mme Aubrey Baptiste aurait promis d'écrire une lettre expliquant pourquoi l'autorisation a été retirée, mais aucune lettre n'a encore été reçue
Nous serons heureux d'intégrer les notes de M. Byron Dav à la bibliographie, comme un autre livre de chevet que les députés pourront garder à l'esprit
Madame la Présidente, je voudrais tout d'abord remercier M. Christian Caro pour son rapport qui a pour thème central la sécurité des transports
Par conséquent, j'ai déposé quelques amendements au rapport intrinsèquement excellent de M. Christian Caro, qui ont été adoptés par notre commission
Nous continuerons à le faire avec énergie et cohérence et, comme l'a dit M. Demetrius Bk lors du débat, 'nécessairement avec une vigilance accrue'
Je voudrais également faire quelques commentaires, tout d'abord, Monsieur Hocine Armando, concernant l'évaluation que vous avez faite de ce sixième rapport périodique

data_raw: I would like to repeat my appreciation to all the speakers and especially to the rapporteur, Mr Koch.
Yes, Mr Evans, I feel an initiative of the type you have just suggested would be entirely appropriate.
Mr President, I am happy to take the floor in the debate on this report and I congratulate Mrs Theato.
I would therefore ask you, Mr Prodi, to make an explicit reference to this problem in your reply today.
Meanwhile, Mr van Hulten has been inundated with amendments, more than 100 amendments in the first round.
Mr President, firstly I would like to extend my heartfelt congratulations to my colleague, Mr van Hulten.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to begin by thanking Mrs Schroedter, the rapporteur, for her work.
Mrs Schroedter' s report marks a further step towards the transparency and effectiveness of structural aid.
One or two years ago, Parliament adopted a report by Mrs Lööw which is extremely important in this context.
I would merely say that the festive issue which Mr Dimitrakopoulos has raised is an extremely important one.
Not even Mr Sichrovsky' s web of lies or Mrs Stenzel' s words of appeasement can do anything to change that.
Mr President, Commissioner, I would like to thank Mr Langen for his excellent work in this important matter.
Yes, Mrs Schroedter, I shall be pleased to look into the facts of this case when I have received your letter.
As you know, like Mr Rack, I come from a transit country, where this issue plays a particularly important role.
Mrs Plooij-van Gorsel, I can tell you that this matter is on the agenda for the Quaestors' meeting on Wednesday.
I would like Mr Barón Crespo, who made the request, to speak to propose it. That is, if he so wishes, of course.
Mr President, Commissioner, I want to begin by thanking Mr Rapkay for a good report and constructive cooperation.
Mr Rapkay' s report also emphasises the importance of the international dimension with regard to competition law.
Mrs Stenzel' s report has, however, turned out very well, at least where the prescribed guidelines are concerned.
Mr President, Commissioner, in this minute and a half I should like, first of all, to congratulate Mrs Schroedter.

Madam President, I clearly owe Mr Wurtz an explanation, and I am going give this explanation before the whole House.
Mr President, Torrey Canyon, Olympic Bravery, Haven, Amoco Cadiz, Gino, Tanio, so many names we remember with horror.
I have clearly received your series of messages on this subject and I believe that Mrs Banotti has an answer for you.
Mr President, I would like to start by extending my compliments to the rapporteur, Mr van Hulten, on his first report.
Madam President, Mr Jonckheer has stated that this could be one of the measures for stabilising the financial markets.
In other words, we should ensure that the money falls to Mr Kouchner' s sphere of competence and not to other spheres.
In her report, Mrs Flautre also drew attention to an area where coordination is sorely lacking, yet desperately needed.
Mr President, I also wish to congratulate Mr van Hulten on this first piece of work which he is presenting to the House.
Mr Alavanos, I would like to say that I have the greatest sympathy for the concern underlying the issue you have raised.
And so, Mr Seppänen, I shall also mention at this point, speaking of the national level, the link with the Cohesion Fund.
Mr President, it is incumbent upon me to remind my colleague, Mr Evans, of why Wales actually achieved Objective 1 status.
In this regard, I liked your term, Mrs Palacio Vallelersundi: we must all pull together, preferably in the same direction.
Mr President, I would like, in beginning my speech regarding the White Paper, to congratulate the rapporteur, Mr von Wogau.
Mrs Theato probably forgot to include a European prison now that we have the FBI, the European police, in the form of OLAF.
The manufacturers have tricked Mr Florenz and Mr Lange into tabling amendments here which seriously weaken these proposals.
I would like to point out to Mrs Albright that what we have read recently in the press is true, and that figures do not lie.
My colleagues, Mrs Frassoni and Mr Onesta have already spoken, somewhat sceptically, about some aspects of the matter in hand.
Madam President, I do not wish to reopen the debate, but I had also asked for the floor, to comment on Mr Barón Crespo's motion.
This is extraordinarily positive, and there is cause to thank the rapporteur, Mr Koch, for the work he has put in on this issue.
Mr Jonckheer, I would like to thank you just as warmly for your report on the seventh survey on State aid in the European Union.
At the request of a French Member, Mr Zimeray, a petition has already been presented, which many people signed, including myself.
I therefore give the floor immediately to Mr Bourlanges, in his capacity as draftsman of the opinion of the Committee on Budgets.
I commend Mr Florenz, Mr Lange and others who have sought from both sides of the party divide a compromise based on shared costs.

We will be happy to incorporate Mr Patten' s notes into the bibliography, as another bedside book for the Members to bear in mind.
Madam President, first of all I should like to thank Mr Koch for his report which has, at its heart, the issue of transport safety.
Consequently, I have tabled some amendments to Mr Koch' s intrinsically excellent report, which have been adopted by our committee.
We will continue to do that with energy and with consistency and as Mr Cox said in the debate, 'necessarily with acute vigilance' .
I should also like to make a few comments, firstly, Mr Berend, regarding the assessment you have made of this sixth periodic report.
